  • Method Details

    • act

      public void act(itumulator.world.World world)
      Description copied from interface: itumulator.simulator.Actor
      The method called whenever the actor needs to simulate actions. The worlds 'current location' is only set at the time when the method is called. Thus, if you use setTile, remove, or delete, the current position does not automatically update. This has multiple implications, e.g., if you want to use World.getSurroundingTiles() after using World.setTile(itumulator.world.Location, java.lang.Object) within the act method, the program will throw an exception. This can be circumvented by updating the current location (World.setCurrentLocation(itumulator.world.Location)) or exclusively using the World methods which accepts a location parameter (by the same name).
      Specified by:
      act in interface itumulator.simulator.Actor
      Parameters:
      world - providing details of the position on which the actor is currently located and much more.

      public RabbitHole findNearestRabbitHole(itumulator.world.World world)

      Returns:
      the nearest RabbitHole object, or null if none are found

    • moveToOrDigHole

      public void moveToOrDigHole(itumulator.world.World world)
      Moves the rabbit toward the nearest rabbit hole using moveTowards() if one exists. If no rabbit hole is nearby, the rabbit digs a new hole.
      Parameters:
      world - the world in which the rabbit is located

      Returns:

    • digHole

      public void digHole(itumulator.world.World world)
      Digs a new rabbit hole at the rabbits location in the world. This method sets the rabbit's `rabbitHole` attribute to the new hole.
      Parameters:
      world - the world in which the rabbit digs a hole
